message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY 

The paper discusses the use of deep neural networks for improving the quality of synthetic voices, which falls under the sub-category of speech synthesis. The paper also mentions the use of HMM-based speech synthesis, which is a sub-field of speech synthesis. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.SD (Sound). Additionally, the paper mentions the incorporation of linguistic styles, which falls under the sub-category of natural language processing, specifically text-to-speech synthesis, which could be categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The use of deep neural networks also falls under the sub-categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the proposed method to improve the quality of synthetic voices, which could be categorized under the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY).
